Article.ArticleTitle: Well-defined Fe<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@MIL-100(Fe) hollow nanoflower heterostructures for selective dection and monitoring of benzoylurea insecticides from food and water.

AbstractText: Developing a platform for the selective detection and effective monitor of toxic contaminants is a major challenge to address organic contaminants contamination in environmental science. Here, for the first time, the thickness-controllable Fe<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@MIL-100(Fe) heterogeneous materials with special hollow nanoflower (HFs) morphology had been synthesized. The morphology and shell thickness of the nano-petal could be tuned by changing the reaction time. The resultant Fe<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@MIL-100(Fe) HFs exhibited the hollow nanoflower shapes and exposed abundant accessible active sites. The enrichment performance of Fe<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@MIL-100(Fe) HFs was approximately 1.4-1.7 times that of spherical Fe<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>@MIL-100(Fe) composite for benzoylurea insecticides (BUs). Furthermore, the optimal sample achieved the wide linearity (0.05-500 ng mL<sup>-1</sup>) and low limits of detection, (0.003-0.01 ng mL<sup>-1</sup>) for BUs. The research provides a new strategy for highly sensitive detection and monitoring of harmful pollutant levels in the environment.
